title: Falls of Foyer Walk Route

images.title: Carol Walker / Falls of Foyers
images.caption: Falls of Foyers. This is a short but spectacular walk on the south side of Loch Ness. Start at the gate opposite the shop in Foyers, and stroll down. This photo shows the whole 165ft drop.

images.title: Sarah McGuire / Bridge Over Upper Falls of Foyers
images.caption: Bridge Over Upper Falls of Foyers. The Bridge crosses the River Foyers as it starts its 500 feet plunge to Loch Ness

images.title: sylvia duckworth / The gorge at Foyers
images.caption: Stunning clear view over the gorge at Foyers in late summer. From the track to the Falls viewpoint.

images.title: River Foyers by Anne Burgess, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Foyers.

images.title: Sarah McGuire / Frozen River Foyers going to Loch Ness and Foyers Bay
images.caption: Frozen River going to Loch Ness and Foyers Bay

images.title: View at Foyers by Stephen McKay, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View and bench

description: Visit these wonderful waterfalls and enjoy woodland trails and views of Loch Ness. It's a very popular area for walkers with good footpaths taking you through attractive woodland to the spectacular 165 feet high falls. You can park in Upper Foyers and then follow a series of steps down to the gorge and the falls. There are two viewpoints where you can take in the full majesty of the falls and take some photos. After enjoying the rushing water you can return the same way by climbing the steps up to the car park. You can extend your walk by heading through the forest to the loch and the pretty Foyers Bay. You can then enjoy a stroll along the shoreline of Loch Ness before crossing the River Foyers where it enters the loch. Follow the same path back to the car park to finish the walk. There is a nice tea shop in the village where you can enjoy refreshment after the steep stepped climb. There's tables outside where you can enjoy great views across the loch. See the street view link to see the area.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: On the eastern side of the loch there's the lovely Dores Beach, Loch Duntelchaig, Loch Ashie and the RSPB nature reserve at Loch Ruthven to explore. For more walking ideas in the area see the Scottish Highlands Walks page.

display_address: B852, Foyers, Highland, Alba / Scotland, IV2 6XX, United Kingdom
